News

ALTA Founded

ALTA, the Australasian Language Technology Association, was founded at the 5th Australasian Natural Language Processing Workshop, in Canberra, December 2002.  The ALTA Constitution was approved, and the first executive committee was elected in January 2003.
  • 5th Australasian Natural Language Processing Workshop, Canberra, December 2002
  • ALTA Constitution
  • ALTA Executive Committee

ALTA Website

The ALTA website is new and we welcome your feedback.  Is there any information you would like to see here?  Please send feedback to diego.molla-aliod@mq.edu.au.

Scamseek

Scamseek is a new project to build a surveillance tool for identifying financial scams on the internet, using expert linguistic analysis and automatic document classification techniques. Project partners are the Capital Markets Co-operative Research Centre, the Australian Securities and Investment Commission, the University of Sydney, Macquarie University, and SMARTS Limited.

  • Capital Markets CRC Language Technology Program
